meanings.definition: In a manner that is mediocre or average.
meanings.sent1: She performed mesally on the test, neither excelling nor failing.
meanings.sent2: The team played mesally, not standing out but not doing poorly either.
meanings.sent3: He danced mesally at the party, not impressing anyone with his moves.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the painting blended mesally, lacking any vibrant contrasts.
meanings.sent5: The music played mesally in the background, hardly noticeable among the chatter.

meanings.definition: To do something in a lackluster or unenthusiastic way.
meanings.sent1: She mesally completed her chores, showing no excitement or energy.
meanings.sent2: The students mesally recited the poem, lacking passion in their delivery.
meanings.sent3: He mesally attempted the new recipe, resulting in a bland and unappetizing dish.
meanings.sent4: The actor mesally delivered his lines, failing to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent5: The team mesally practiced for the game, showing no drive or determination.
